intro: Solanum juzepczukii var. roseum, commonly known as the pink-flowered nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep rose. Its foliage is typically green with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, often found in moist, shaded environments.
